title: Is there a way to fix fps when client is not closed in game.
body: Recently I have been letting my client stay open in game despite having a toaster for a pc. It was going well till the recent update, now my fps drops really far. I turned it off noticed a huge improvement, but after the game i remembered how long it takes to get back to the lobby. Does anyone know of a solution to this, or do I have to choose between better game quality, or more convenience after the game.

replies.body:
Let's do some basic steps really quickly by checking for any possible driver updates you might have missed first, but also check to see if the Windows Game DVR Bar was turned back on after a Windows Update. That feature has been known to cause some fps issues for a lot of players.

It might be best to leave that option turned on if nothing else seems to help though! It's better to have good fps and have to wait a bit after the match than have to struggle to land your skillshots.
